[[File:Letter to Mr Britten.jpg: On [[11 November]] [[1956]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
thumb]]: a letter]] to a Mr Britten'''.<ref name=TS>{{webcite
column11: articlename=BBC Caversham Park 1 (aired 2 April 2017; ca. 15 min. mark.)

[[File:Letter to Mr Britten.jpg: *'''Contents:''' Among topics included, the letter discusses [[Gimli]] and [[Legolas]], and on "the top of one page Tolkien mentions the nomenclature regarding names for places in the [[Shire]]" apparently "crediting [[Christopher Tolkien
thumb]]: Christopher]] for one or more of them, explaining that it was Christopher who drew the map". Further, at "the bottom of the same page, JRR expresses his delight at a question regarding the verse [[Oliphaunt (poem)
column3: ''Oliphaunt'']], saying that almost none of the reviewers had mentioned his poetry; except [[W.H. Auden
